Column Comment.0: SPATIAL DESCRIPTION: The surface and sub-surface description of any object thatoccupies an area, such as a land right, field, facility or area of interest. The surfacedescription may be stated in terms of a legal survey system, metes and bounds orpolygon. The mineral zone description describes the minerals (substances) andsubsurface definition (zones/formations) that are included in the definition. For landrights, continuations may be described by generating a new Spatial description.LAND LEGAL DESCRIPTION ID: Unique sequence number identifying the land legaldescription.
Column Comment.1: SPATIAL DESCRIPTION OBSERVATION NUMBER: a unique series number for thespatial description, allowing the spatial description to be versioned over time.
Column Comment.2: PARCEL IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a parcel that describes a spatial object. Insome cases, it is convenient to make this ID the same as the ID for the parcel againstwhich it is validated (same as SP_PARCEL_XXX)
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: DESCRIPTION: Describes areas which are only partially included in the land parcelsmallest unit described (such as quarter LSD for DLS survey system)
Column Comment.5: DOMINION LAND SURVEY ROAD ALLOWANCE: The unique identifier for the roadallowance associated with the DLS grid.
Column Comment.6: EFFECTIVE DATE: Date on which the land parcel became effective
Column Comment.7: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.8: GROSS SIZE : The gross parcel size in terms of working interest
Column Comment.10: INACTIVATION DATE: Date on which the parcel was actually inactivated. Not thesame as expiry date, which is the date on which the primary term of the agreementends.
Column Comment.11: LOCAL COORDINATE REFERENCE SYSTEM IDENTIFIER: Identifier for a localreference coordinate system, such as an ATS or STS version, that this parceldefinition is based on.
Column Comment.12: SPATIAL PARCEL CARTER: this table provides an ennumerated list of the parcelsincluded in the carter survey system. These parcels may be referenced whendescribing the spatial extent of a business object such as a land right, field or pool.
Column Comment.13: SPATIAL PARCEL CONGRESSIONAL: an ennumerated list of the parcels includedin the congressional survey system. These parcels may be referenced whendescribing the spatial extent of a business object such as a land right, field or pool.
Column Comment.14: SPATIAL PARCEL DOMINION LAND SURVEY: an ennumerated list of the parcelsincluded in the DLS survey system. These parcels may be referenced whendescribing the spatial extent of a business object such as a land right, field or pool.
Column Comment.15: SPATIAL PARCEL FEDERAL PERMIT SYSTEM: an ennumerated list of the parcelsincluded in the FPS Survey system. These parcels may be referenced whendescribing the spatial extent of a business object such as a land right, field or pool.
Column Comment.16: SPATIAL PARCEL LIBYA: an ennumerated list of the parcels included in the Libyansurvey system. These parcels may be referenced when describing the spatial extentof a business object such as a land right, field or pool.
Column Comment.17: PARCEL_LOT: unique identifier for the parcel lot. If desired, may be populated withthe ID of the land parcel to be described, although the appropriate FK column shouldalso be populated.
Column Comment.18: LOT NUM: An alpha numeric identifier assigned to the lot, possibly by a municipalityor county.
Column Comment.19: PARCEL LOT TYPE: the type of parcel lot descibed. Used to describe the type of USland parcel lots, in the congressional legal survey system.
Column Comment.20: SPATIAL PARCEL NE LOCATION: an ennumerated list of the parcels included in theNE LOCATION Survey system. These parcels may be referenced when describingthe spatial extent of a business object such as a land right, field or pool.
Column Comment.21: SPATIAL PARCEL NORTH SEA LOCATION: an ennumerated list of the parcelsincluded in the NORTH SEA LOCATION Survey system. These parcels may bereferenced when describing the spatial extent of a business object such as a landright, field or pool.
Column Comment.22: SPATIAL PARCEL NE LOCATION: an ennumerated list of the parcels included in theNE LOCATION Survey system. These parcels may be referenced when describingthe spatial extent of a business object such as a land right, field or pool.
Column Comment.23: SPATIAL PARCELOFFSHORE LOCATION: an ennumerated list of the parcelsincluded in the Offshore Survey system. These parcels may be referenced whendescribing the spatial extent of a business object such as a land right, field or pool.
Column Comment.24: SPATIAL PARCEL OHIO LOCATION: an ennumerated list of the parcels included inthe Ohio Survey system. These parcels may be referenced when describing thespatial extent of a business object such as a land right, field or pool.
Column Comment.25: SPATIAL PARCEL PUBLIC LAND BLOCK LOCATION: an ennumerated list of theparcels included in the Public land block Survey system in Alberta Canada. Theseparcels may be referenced when describing the spatial extent of a business objectsuch as a land right, field or pool.
Column Comment.26: SPATIAL PARCEL TEXAS LOCATION: an ennumerated list of the parcels includedin the Texas Survey system. These parcels may be referenced when describing thespatial extent of a business object such as a land right, field or pool.
Column Comment.27: PERCENT OWNERSHIP: Ownership of the holder of the database. For completeownership, a breakout table is needed.
Column Comment.28: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.29: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.30: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.31: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.32: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.33: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.34: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.35: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.36: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.37: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
